intro: [WRONG START] Phaseolus lanceolatus, commonly known as the lanceolate bean, is a species of flowering plant in the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Central and South America and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and climbing habit. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several edible seeds, similar to common beans. It thrives in warm, tropical climates and is often cultivated for its nutritional value. Its botanical features make it an important species in both traditional agriculture and ecological studies.
